nodes.bodyText: I'm kind of surprised that there isn't a simpler way to do this. But, 🤷
Java generics and inheritance continue to suck.
Yeah, I don't imagine ImmutableOpenMap is buying us too much. Might be worth git blame to see if there is anything back in the mists of time explaining it.

I did some digging and this appears to have been there since the beginning, when ImmutableOpenMap was used all over the place.  I think it was initially supposed to be slightly more memory efficient, and the immutability was a nice add-on, but more modern JVMs and Collections.immutableMap() make that matter less.
Wrap in unmodifiableMap or call Map.of on it? Just for extra double paranoia that it is immutable.
Weird. That, like, doesn't do anything, right?
I guess it used to, hence the comment, but no longer indeed
Same comment about double super paranoid immutability.
I'm so happy we sorted this. I know we did it for an odd reason around loops in mapping updates, but it just makes the output nicer to read.

I wonder, not that it matters, but, is it faster to do list = new List(mappers.values()); Collections.sort(list);. Sorting a stream feels funny to me because it is a forwards only data structure and feels like it'll amount to just sorting anyway. Whatever. It super doesn't matter.

Oh! It's worth triple checking that this doesn't change the order from before. It sure looks the same to me but please make sure we have a test. We need the same order as before or things can get "fun" in a mixed version cluster.
I'd make this a Set because weird things will happen if there are dupes, I think.
